name: In Between
description: Cancer is everyone's business! Till 31st January 2019, 50% of revenues from all purchases for "In Between" will go directly to the Cancer Research Institute as donations, in order to support the battle against cancer.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo at 2 GHz, or AMD Athlon 64 X2 2 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Intel HD4000 DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Probably many would say at this point, just from watching the trailer:' oh, it´s just like VVVVVV'. But if you play the game, you soon realise it´s not just another puzzle platformer. Game Design wise it is really interesting because the game introduces puzzle mechanice in the context of the stages of grief, which gives it a lot of meaning. Some Levels are hard as hell O.o and sometimes it´s a torture to get through >.<. But when you actually do, it´s incredibly satisfying. And you have to play the game until the very end, because it´s really worth it an makes a lot of sense as a whole experience.   In Between is a really great game with beautiful handpaintes visuals, a stunning atmosphere and a deep and engaging story. - I promise i cried for 15 minutes - Love to support such an awesome game.
In Between is a challenging puzzle-game with a wonderful background story.   For me it is a MUST BUY!

This is such a neat little game with a great story! The puzzles have you thinking a lot at times and more often than not the solutions are so blatantly obvious... The music fits the game perfectly, the story is easy and nice to follow and the game has a really deep meaning. Combine that with the simple but rather unique mechanics and you've got a great game.  I do not know yet how many hours this game will entertain me but I do intend to finish all of the stages and levels there are!  Thank you for bringing this unique little game to us and I am happy I discovered it now (Better late than never, eh? :))

Totally astonished and surprised by this one - what I thought was throwaway bundle fare wound up being a poignant meditation on life and death, with a powerful ending. The anti-gravity puzzles have alot of variety and I felt they all worked and ramped up in difficulty naturally, and the game gives you the option of skipping the most challenging stages in favor of just advancing the plot if you want to. The exposition meshes with the gameplay in an intuitive manner as well. It's addictive, polished, and ultimately beautiful and I enjoyed it even more than Braid, which is somewhat similar.
This game is amazing. The puzzles are very interesting in and of themselves. And the story line, and how the puzzles represent the emotional content of the narrative, are very engaging.
Great game with nice art, sound and smart puzzles.  8/10
this game is so cool that they let you defy the laws of gravity with a black man!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Awesome Puzzle Platformer. Awesome Story.  The puzzles change based on what the main characters is feeling.
